{"step_by_step_thinking": "The facial bone most prone to fracture is the one that protrudes the most and is therefore most likely to be hit or injured. The mandible, zygoma, and frontal bones are all relatively protected due to their position or strength. The nasal bone, however, protrudes from the face and is relatively fragile, making it the most prone to fracture.", "answer_choice": "B. Nasal"}
